alert.note: Alert for Eastern Monmouth; Middlesex; Western Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued March 03 at 6:11AM EST until March 04 at 11:00AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...One to two feet of inundation above ground level possible in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...Middlesex, Western Monmouth and Eastern Monmouth. * WHEN...From late tonight through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At this level, widespread roadway flooding occurs in coastal and bayside communities and along inland tidal waterways. Many roads become impassable. Some damage to vulnerable structures may begin to occur. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Arthur Kill at Perth Amboy MLLW Categories - Minor 7.2 ft, Moderate 8.2 ft, Major 9.2 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.5 ft, Moderate 2.5 ft, Major 3.5 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- -------- 03/05 AM 5.9 0.2 1.2 None 03/06 PM 5.8 0.1 1.6 None 04/05 AM 9.0 3.3 4.2 Moderate 04/06 PM 6.2 0.5 1.7 None 05/06 AM 6.9 1.2 1.8 None 05/07 PM 5.8 0.1 1.0 None Sandy Hook Bay at Sandy Hook MLLW Categories - Minor 6.7 ft, Moderate 7.7 ft, Major 8.7 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.5 ft, Moderate 2.5 ft, Major 3.5 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- -------- 03/05 AM 5.4 0.2 1.0 None 03/05 PM 5.2 -0.0 1.3 None 04/05 AM 8.6 3.4 4.2 Moderate 04/06 PM 5.8 0.6 1.6 None 05/06 AM 6.6 1.4 1.8 None 05/07 PM 5.4 0.2 1.0 None Watson Creek at Manasquan MLLW Categories - Minor 5.7 ft, Moderate 6.7 ft, Major 7.7 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.3 ft, Moderate 2.3 ft, Major 3.3 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- -------- 03/05 AM 4.3 -0.1 0.4 None 03/05 PM 4.4 -0.0 0.8 None 04/05 AM 6.7 2.3 2.6 Moderate 04/06 PM 5.1 0.7 1.3 None 05/06 AM 5.6 1.2 1.3 None 05/07 PM 4.7 0.3 0.7 None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
